summary: Generates code with invalid for/in left-hand assignment

comments.content: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Compile this: window.Foo = function(A, B, C, D) { if ( A ) { if ( B ) { C = 0; } else { C = 0 in D; } while ( C-- ) {} } } What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: Something that doesn't have a syntax error, maybe window.Foo=function(b,c,a,d){if(b)for(a=c?0:(0 in d);a--;);}; Actual: window.Foo=function(b,c,a,d){if(b)for(a=c?0:0 in d;a--;);}; SyntaxError: Unexpected token ; (Chrome) invalid for/in left-hand side (Firefox) What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? http://closure-compiler.appspot.com/home Please provide any additional information below. I noticed this while attempting to minify jquery

I bisected, and it appears that the first bad commit is 

https://code.google.com/p/closure-compiler/source/detail?r=6842032b7c1857e0cdf690ce25a767b4365dd307

Thanks for the report!

Sounds like a code generation problem.
This issue was closed by revision 8d11b8cc7a61.
